hydrogen.category: diatomic nonmetal, could be considered metalloid

helium.appearance: colorless gas, exhibiting a red-orange glow when placed in a high-voltage electric field

carbon.category: polyatomic nonmetal, sometimes considered a metalloid

fluorine.appearance:
gas: very pale yellow
liquid: bright yellow
solid: alpha is opaque, beta is transparent

neon.appearance: colorless gas exhibiting an orange-red glow when placed in a high voltage electric field

aluminium.category: post-transition metal, sometimes considered a metalloid

phosphorus.appearance: colourless, waxy white, yellow, scarlet, red, violet, black
phosphorus.category: polyatomic nonmetal, sometimes considered a metalloid

argon.appearance: colorless gas exhibiting a lilac/violet glow when placed in a high voltage electric field

calcium.appearance: dull gray, silver; with a pale yellow tint

iron.appearance: lustrous metallic with a grayish tinge

nickel.appearance: lustrous, metallic, and silver with a gold tinge

zinc.category: transition metal, alternatively considered a post-transition metal

selenium.category: polyatomic nonmetal, sometimes considered a metalloid

krypton.appearance: colorless gas, exhibiting a whitish glow in a high electric field

strontium.appearance: silvery white metallic; with a pale yellow tint

cadmium.category: transition metal, alternatively considered a post-transition metal

iodine.appearance: lustrous metallic gray, violet as a gas

xenon.appearance: colorless gas, exhibiting a blue glow when placed in a high voltage electric field

barium.appearance: silvery gray; with a pale yellow tint

lanthanum.category: lanthanide, sometimes considered a transition metal

europium.appearance: silvery white, with a pale yellow tint; but rarely seen without oxide discoloration

ytterbium.appearance: silvery white; with a pale yellow tint

lutetium.category: lanthanide, sometimes considered a transition metal

polonium.category: post-transition metal, but this status is disputed

astatine.category: metalloid, sometimes classified as a nonmetal, or a metal

radon.appearance: colorless gas, occasionally glows green or red in discharge tubes

actinium.appearance: silvery-white, glowing with an eerie blue light; sometimes with a golden cast
actinium.category: actinide, sometimes considered a transition metal

uranium.appearance: silvery gray metallic; corrodes to a spalling black oxide coat in air

plutonium.appearance: silvery white, tarnishing to dark gray in air

curium.appearance: silvery metallic, glows purple in the dark

lawrencium.category: actinide, sometimes considered a transition metal

meitnerium.category: unknown, but probably a transition metal

darmstadtium.category: unknown, but probably a transition metal

roentgenium.category: unknown, but probably a transition metal

ununtrium.category: unknown, but probably a post-transition metal

ununpentium.category: unknown, but probably a post-transition metal

livermorium.category: unknown, but probably a post-transition metal

ununoctium.category: unknown, but predicted to be a noble gas
